com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.entity

Class CommonEntity<T extends org.bukkit.entity.Entity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.bases.ExtendedEntity<T>
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.entity.CommonEntity<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - type of Entity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommonItem, CommonLivingEntity, CommonMinecart

    public class CommonEntity<T extends org.bukkit.entity.Entity>
extends ExtendedEntity<T>
    Wrapper class for additional methods Bukkit can't or doesn't provide.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommonEntity

        public CommonEntity(T entity)

    • Method Detail

      • getNetworkController

        public EntityNetworkController<CommonEntity<T>> getNetworkController()
        Gets the Entity Network Controller currently assigned to this Entity. If none is available, this method returns Null. If no custom network controller is set, this method returns a new DefaultEntityNetworkController instance.
        Returns:
        Entity Network Controller, or null if not available

      • setNetworkController

        public void setNetworkController(EntityNetworkController controller)
        Sets an Entity Network Controller for this Entity. To stop tracking this minecart, pass in Null. To default back to the net.minecraft.server implementation, pass in a new DefaultEntityNetworkController instance.

        This method only works if the Entity world has previously been set.
        Parameters:
        controller - to set to

      • getController

        public <C extends EntityController<?>> C getController(java.lang.Class<? extends C> controllerType)
        Gets the Entity Controller currently assigned to this Entity, checking to make sure the controller is of a certain Class type. When no custom controller is set, or the current controller can not be assigned to the type specified, null is returned instead.

        This method offers performance benefits over getController() by not instantiating a new default controller when no controller is set.
        Parameters:
        controllerType - to get
        Returns:
        the controller of controllerType, or null if not found

      • getController

        public EntityController<CommonEntity<T>> getController()
        Gets the Entity Controller currently assigned to this Entity. If no custom controller is set, this method returns a new DefaultEntityController instance.
        Returns:
        Entity Controller

      • setController

        public void setController(EntityController controller)
        Sets an Entity Controller for this Entity. This method throws an Exception if this kind of Entity is not supported.
        Parameters:
        controller - to set to

      • hasControllerSupport

        public boolean hasControllerSupport()
        Checks whether this particular Entity supports the use of Entity Controllers. If this method returns True, setController(EntityController) can be used.

        Note that Entity Network Controllers are always supported.

        Returns:
        True if Entity Controllers are supported, False if not

      • doPostTick

        public void doPostTick()
        Performs all the logic normally performed after ticking a single Entity. If onTick is managed externally, this method keeps it compatible. Calling this method results in the entity properly moved between chunks, and other logic.

      • teleport

        public boolean teleport(org.bukkit.Location location,
                        org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerTeleportEvent.TeleportCause cause)
        Overrides:
        teleport in class ExtendedEntity<T extends org.bukkit.entity.Entity>

      • spawn

        public static final CommonEntity spawn(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType,
                                       org.bukkit.Location location,
                                       EntityController controller,
                                       EntityNetworkController networkController)
        Creates a new Entity and spawns it at the Location and using the controllers specified.
        Parameters:
        entityType - to spawn
        location - to spawn at
        controller - to assign to the Entity after spawning
        networkController - to assign to the Entity after spawning
        Returns:
        True if spawning occurred, False if not
        See Also:
        #spawn(Location)

      • create

        public static final CommonEntity create(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType,
                                        org.bukkit.Location location)
        Creates a new Entity instance by calling its default World constructor, and initialized position. Unlike #spawn() this does not spawn the entity in the world, and it will stay detached.
        Parameters:
        entityType - to create
        location - of the entity
        Returns:
        created entity

      • createNull

        public static final CommonEntity createNull(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
        Creates a new Entity instance without validly constructing it. Please avoid using this as it will cause serious bugs when spawned into a world.
        Parameters:
        entityType - type to create
        Returns:
        CommonEntity

      • get

        public static CommonItem get(org.bukkit.entity.Item item)
        Obtains a (new) CommonItem instance providing additional methods for the Item specified. This method never returns null, unless the input Entity is null.
        Parameters:
        item - to get a CommonItem for
        Returns:
        a (new) CommonItem instance for the Item

      • get

        public static CommonPlayer get(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Obtains a (new) CommonPlayer instance providing additional methods for the Player specified. This method never returns null, unless the input Entity is null.
        Parameters:
        player - to get a CommonPlayer for
        Returns:
        a (new) CommonPlayer instance for the Player

      • get

        public static <T extends org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity,C extends CommonLivingEntity<? extends T>> C get(T livingEntity)
        Obtains a (new) CommonLivingEntity instance providing additional methods for the Living Entity specified. This method never returns null, unless the input Entity is null.
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - to get a CommonLivingEntity for
        Returns:
        a (new) CommonLivingEntity instance for the Living Entity

      • get

        public static <T extends org.bukkit.entity.Entity,C extends CommonEntity<? extends T>> C get(T entity,
                                                                                             java.lang.Class<C> type)
        Obtains a (new) CommonEntity instance providing additional methods for the Entity specified. A specific CommonEntity extension that best fits the input Entity can be requested using this method. This method never returns null, unless the input Entity is null.
        Parameters:
        entity - to get a CommonEntity for
        type - of CommonEntity to get
        Returns:
        a (new) CommonEntity type requested, or null if casting failed/entity is invalid

      • get

        public static <T extends org.bukkit.entity.Entity> CommonEntity<T> get(T entity)
        Obtains a (new) CommonEntity instance providing additional methods for the Entity specified. This method never returns null, unless the input Entity is null.
        Parameters:
        entity - to get a CommonEntity for
        Returns:
        a (new) CommonEntity instance for the Entity

      • clearControllers

        public static void clearControllers(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
        Clears possible network or Entity controllers from the Entity. This should be called when a specific Entity should default back to all default behaviours.
        Parameters:
        entity - to clear the controllers of
